Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label two distinct habitats: one land-based and one aquatic.
The student can include a variety of appropriate living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, lizards, and squirrels in the land habitat.
The student can accurately depict fish, clams, and aquatic plants in the water habitat.
The student can clearly show the differences between the types of living things found in each habitat by comparing at least one organism from each.
The student can effectively represent patterns of plant and animal diversity by illustrating how certain species are specific to their respective habitats.
CANNOT: The student may have occasional minor omissions in labeling one or two living things (e.g., forgetting to label a specific plant).
The student might not show less common interactions between species, such as symbiosis, unless explicitly asked to do so (focusing instead on presence and diversity).
